Science Intranet

Client
Faculty of Science, University of Alberta

Services
User Experience, Prototyping, Front End Development, Project Management

Tools
Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Google Sites


Overview

The Faculty of Science was looking for a way to better communicate with its departments, reduce the amount of duplicated information that was being maintained by each unit and optimize its external web presence by removing competing, internal information.

Solution

The Science Intranet was the result of many feedback sessions, surveys and user experience meetings with faculty and staff from every department in Science. A customized Google Site in-line with the institutional look and feel allowed multiple contributors from various groups in the Dean's office to easily update content. As well, having this space gave the Associate Deans a place to record procedures and processes, allowing for greater continuity as roles changed.

Highlights

Single contact list

  • Updating the master contact list (in Google Sheets) would push the changes throughout the Science Intranet
  • This list powered a searchable and sortable Science directory
  • Contact lists by department with the most up-to-date information could be generated as a PDF file to share with units outside of Science

Dean's office portfolios

  • Each portfolio in the dean's office was given its own section on the Science Intranet to more clearly communicate their role and quickly disseminate any updates
